newsitem.title: USA: AMP enters Internet commerce market.
newsitem.headline: AMP enters Internet commerce market.

text.p: - Electrical and electronic connector giant AMP Inc. on Monday will announce its entry into the Internet commerce market.
Jim Kessler, director of AMP eMerce Internet Solutions, said the new division to be unveiled on Monday was to forge for AMP "a leading position in Internet commerce."
Kessler said in an interview here AMP's that launch follows five years of testing a variety of new technologies from fax-back product information to CD-ROM and Internet catalogues.

The company plans an October-November pilot of a business-to-business transaction system. In December, AMP will launch a programme that will offer select customers contract pricing, sample orders, literature orders, and 3-D models on demand.
Although seemingly a major new business for the Harrisburg, Pa.-based company, whose 1995 revenues topped $5.2 billion, Kessler said the project sprung from a bid to solve its own internal challenge.
The company markets some 200,000 products worldwide, with customers of many different languages and offerings often varying from country to country.
To provide information about its products, Kessler said, AMP has been spending some $7 million to $10 million a year in publishing some 400 paper catalogues.
With 200 part number changes among AMP's myriad offerings a day, and a nine-month lead time to produce catalogues, these were by definition out of date before they even hit the press.
